title: Dynamic text content type has no effect
description: When setting the Content Type property of a dynamic text element to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report displays the same results. However, the expected behavior is as follows:
OB: The report displays the same results whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML.
EB: For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed. For Auto, I expect content 1, 2, and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Set the Content Type property of the dynamic text element to Plain.
3. Observe if the literal content (tags and all) is displayed correctly.
4. Set the Content Type property of the dynamic text element to Auto.
5. Observe if content 1, 2, and 3 appear properly without HTML or RTF tags.
6. Set the Content Type property of the dynamic text element to HTML.
7. Observe if content 1 and 2 appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 appears literally with RTF tags.
